VLIB Function Reference

Gradients, Magnitude, and Orientation

Introduction and Use Cases

Gradient magnitudes and orientation can be useful in computer vision applications for helping to find edges (see Canny Edge Detection). They also offer a more robust method for for texture and feature matching than intensity dependent methods when lighting conditions or scene brightness changes. Gradient orientation binning is also part of the Histogram of Oriented Gradients (HOG) algorithm.

Specification

Function

These functions each take an 8-bit input image, and return different variants of gradients, magnitudes, and orientations.

Variants

This functionality is available in four output format variants:
  • Returns only x and y gradients of each pixel : VLIB_xyGradients
  • Returns x and y gradients and the gradient magnitude of each pixel : VLIB_xyGradientsAndMagnitude
  • Returns the gradient magnitude and orientation bin of each pixel using fixed point math : VLIB_xyGradients_Magnitude_Orientations

Method

The method for each variant is included in the API documentation links below.

APIS

  • VLIB_xyGradients
  • VLIB_xyGradientsAndMagnitude
  • VLIB_xyGradients_Magnitude_Orientations
